Camels Multifield Challenge

GoalsÂ¶

Each CMC map is characterized by 6 numbers: two cosmological parameters \(\Omega_{\rm m}\) (that quantifies the fraction of matter over the total energy content in the Universe), and \(\sigma_8\) (that set the variance of linear matter fluctuations), and 4 astrophysical parameters \(A_{\rm SN1}\), \(A_{\rm SN2}\), \(A_{\rm AGN1}\), \(A_{\rm AGN2}\), that characterized the strength of the astrophysical processes (supernova and AGN feedback).

CMC goals are:

  • Build models to infer the value of the cosmological parameters with the highest accuracy.

  • Build models that trained on one set of simulations (e.g. IllustrisTNG) can infer the correct cosmology when tested on the other set (e.g. SIMBA).

  • Determine the minimum set of fields than contain 90% and 95% of the cosmological and astrophysical information.

We provide access to the benchmark models here
